com.jme3.shader

Class ShaderNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jme3.shader.ShaderNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Savable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class ShaderNode
extends java.lang.Object
implements Savable, java.lang.Cloneable
    A ShaderNode is the unit brick part of a shader program. A shader can be describe with several shader nodes that are plugged together through inputs and outputs. A ShaderNode is based on a definition that has a shader code, inputs and output variables. This node can be activated based on a condition, and has input and output mapping. This class is not intended to be used by JME users directly. It's the structure for loading shader nodes from a J3md material definition file
